legal.title: Legal Protection
legal.description: This section outlines the legal framework for hate speech in multiple countries. The goal is to help users understand their rights, identify the official authorities responsible for receiving reports, and distinguish between what constitutes illegal speech and what falls under freedom of expression.

hateSpeechContent.definitionText: is any expression that incites violence, discrimination, or hostility against individuals or groups based on their identity or belonging, such as:
hateSpeechContent.keyElementsText: Hate speech must include incitement or a call for violence/discrimination, not just the expression of an opposing opinion.
whatWeMonitor: calls for extermination or collective violence
intentional misinformation that harms a specific group
hateSpeechContent.whatWeDoNotTitle: What is not subject to legal follow-up?
whatWeDoNot: personal disputes not related to hate speech
non-public content such as private messages
reports without evidence or a verifiable link
hateSpeechContent.differenceTitle: Hate Speech vs. Freedom of Expression
protectedItems: objective criticism of ideas and beliefs
constructive critique of policies and practices
notProtectedItems: incitement to violence against a group
defamation of a group based on identity
spreading false information to stir hatred
hateSpeechContent.boundaryText: Freedom of expression ends where incitement to hatred or violence begins. You may criticize ideas, but you cannot incite harm against people because of who they are.

documentationContent.screenshotIntro: A screenshot is the primary piece of evidence in any report. It must contain complete information to prove the violation and preserve the context.
documentationContent.mustIncludeTitle: What a valid screenshot must include
mustInclude: the full text of the offending content
the account or page name clearly visible
profile picture of the content publisher
mistakes: cutting part of the text or removing context
taking the screenshot after the post is deleted
failing to save the original post link
documentationContent.proTipText: Always take a full-page screenshot rather than cropping a portion. Full context increases credibility and legal admissibility.
documentationContent.archivingIntro: In addition to the screenshot, use archiving tools to create a permanent version of the content.

archiveTools.name: Perma.cc
archiveTools.description: Permanent link creation for webpage content

archivingSteps: Copy the link of the violating post
Open one of the archiving tools listed above
Paste the link into the archive submission field
Save the archive link generated afterward
Attach the archive link along with your report
securityTips: keep multiple backups in separate locations
record the date and time each file is saved
documentationContent.retentionText: keep evidence for at least one year from the reporting date, as it may be needed for legal follow-up or appeal.
quickTips: document immediately ‚Äî content may be deleted
take multiple screenshots from different scroll points
save comment sections if relevant to context
record screen-video if the content is animated

reportingContent.methodText: Submit an official report in person or through a lawyer
reportingContent.tipText: Keep a copy of the report and the registration number for follow-up.
reportingContent.outsideSyriaText: You can report hate speech crimes in your country of residence. Check the 'Applicable Laws' tab to see the laws and competent authorities in each country.
reportingContent.workflowTitle: How do we handle dangerous reports?
reportingContent.limitationsText: The Baligh Initiative does not provide direct legal representation. Our role is limited to analyzing reports, providing initial advice, and directing victims to competent authorities and accredited lawyers.

lawsContent.title: International Laws Against Hate Speech
lawsContent.description: The legal framework for combating hate speech varies from country to country, but most democratic nations criminalize incitement to violence and hatred against individuals or groups based on protected characteristics such as race, religion, nationality, or ethnicity.
lawsContent.sectionInfo: In this section: You will find detailed legal information for each country, including applicable laws, the definition of hate speech, and the official authorities responsible for receiving reports. Click on any country in the map below to see details.

mistakes.solution: Ensure you provide clear screenshots, links, and the date of publication.

mistakes.mistake: Confusing personal opinion with hate speech
mistakes.solution: Ensure there is clear incitement to violence or discrimination.
Hate speech must be public for legal follow-up.
Use archiving tools and keep multiple copies.
Document immediately, and use archiving tools before deletion.

faqs.a: Yes, you can report anonymously through our platform. However, for official legal follow-up, authorities may need your identity as a witness.

faqs.q: What if the content is in a private message?
faqs.a: Private content is difficult to pursue legally unless it constitutes a direct threat. We recommend reporting directly to the police in cases of personal threats.

faqs.q: Do I need a lawyer to report?
faqs.a: Not necessary for the initial report. However, if it escalates to a legal case, you may need to consult a lawyer specializing in hate speech cases.

faqs.q: How long does the investigation take?
faqs.a: It varies by country and authority. It may take from weeks to several months. Keep the report number for follow-up.

faqs.q: What if the content was deleted before reporting?
faqs.a: If you documented the content (screenshot + archiving), you can report. Saved evidence is sufficient for legal follow-up.
Yes, but it is better to report immediately. Some laws have statutes of limitations. Check the law in your country.
Authorities review the report, investigate the content, and may request additional information. The publisher may be summoned for questioning or legal action taken.
Not necessarily. Removal depends on platform policies and local laws. However, official reporting increases the chances of action being taken.

faqContent.helpText: Contact us directly and we will help you understand the appropriate legal procedures for your case.
